transportAdvice: Cape Cod has a seasonal bus network that connects major towns and beaches, but a car is strongly recommended for exploring the peninsula fully, as many areas are spread out and not walkable between destinations. Taxis and ride-hail services are available, particularly in larger towns, but coverage can be limited in off-peak seasons.

weather.description: Cold and quiet winter month with occasional snow and strong coastal winds; most tourist attractions are closed.
Still firmly winter with freezing temperatures and a chance of snow or sleet; the Cape is largely off-season.
Early signs of spring but still chilly and unpredictable; some businesses begin reopening toward month's end.
Mild and fresh with blooming landscapes; a pleasant time to visit before summer crowds arrive.
Comfortable and increasingly warm with longer days; a great shoulder-season month before peak tourism.
Early summer brings warm, sunny days and the start of the busy tourist season; beaches begin to fill.
Peak summer with warm ocean water, crowded beaches, and lively towns; the most popular month to visit.
Equally busy and warm as July with ideal beach conditions; accommodation books out well in advance.
A lovely shoulder month as crowds thin but weather remains warm and pleasant for outdoor activities.
Crisp autumn air and beautiful fall foliage make this a scenic time to visit with far fewer tourists.
Cool and increasingly quiet as the off-season sets in; many seasonal businesses close for the year.
Cold winter conditions return with a chance of snow; a peaceful but limited experience for visitors.
